results.title: Flight of the innocent = La Corsa dell' innocente
results.creator_credit: Carlo Carlei, Domenico Procacci, Franco Castaldi, Cristaldifilm and Fandango
results.brief_description: This breathtakingly visual film, the first feature by Carlo Carei, captures the emotions and arouses the senses. Since 1966, due to the depressed economy in southern Italy, kidnapping has become almost an alternative industry. Men, women and children, from the wealthy north are kidnapped and used as bartering chips by their merciless captors. Feuds develop between rival gangs. Many survive…others are not so fortunate. The story centres upon Vito, a young Italian child whose family are in the kidnapping business and are brutally murdered by a rival gang. He escapes on a perilous journey with the murderers in hot pursuit. Although “Flight of the innocent” is fictional, similar events to those depicted continue to occur. Italian dialogue. English subtitles.

results.title: Recreation and leisure
results.creator_credit: Tim Abbott, Helen Edwards, Tony Shaddock and Dept of Health, Richmond Implementation Unit
results.brief_description: Designed to assist the intellectual disability residential care worker to appreciate the benefits of recreation and leisure, learn how to develop a recreation and leisure program, develop the skills to instruct residents and learn how to evaluate the success of the program. Accompanied by 31p. in-service training manual. At the conclusion of this program the “No excuses. Life. Be In It” advertisment targeting people with disabilities and featuring an amputee, deaf person and paraplegic is screened.

results.title: Flies: the great Australian salute!
results.brief_description: This video examines the physiology and life cycle of the Australian fly and shows in a humorous way how they have a place in our culture.

results.title: Flat
results.brief_description: Carried out in a 2D reality, repetitive motions mirror the mechanical patterns in modern society. In this one-shot abstracted sequence, abscuring motion and direction, repeated gestures move beyond meaning and into compulsive necessity. Detail magnifies while reason fades.

results.title: Flemingdon Park: the global village
results.creator_credit: Andrew Faiz, Gerry Flahive and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A trendy urban development in Toronto for professionals and artists turned subsidized housing which attracted thousands of refugees and new immigrants, Flemingdon Park has become known as a multicultural model for urban planning. This documentary discusses the past and present community of Flemingdon Park, as well as the challenges the diverse residents face and the valuable lessons offered by the community that has developed there. From a history of overcoming violence and racism to the hope of the celebration of difference in increasingly inclusive and welcoming community attitudes there are many and varied facets to life in and around the Park. Many of these elements are touched on in this program in order to come to terms with the history and current experience of the community through interviews with past and present residents, teachers and students from neighbouring schools, the Park’s designer and architect and through commentary from journalist Robert Fulford and the documentary’s director, Andrew Faiz, himself a former resident.

results.title: Five Go to Smuggler's Top
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Famous Five”.
The Five go to Smuggler’s Top to stay with the Lenoir family. It is not long before they meet the eccentric Mr Barlowe - a man who seems to be responsible for the queer and highly suspicious things that are happening in the area. The five face a mystery full of excitement in and out of the underground secret passages and on the surrounding sea marshes. Rated: G

results.title: Five go down to the sea
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Famous Five”.
While on a cycling holiday in Cornwall, the Five hear how in the past, pirates used to set up a light on stormy nights on the Tremannon coast to wreck ships. The children investigate the cove at night and find that there are still mysterious lights and some sinister goings-on.

results.title: Five are together again. Parts 1 & 2
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Famous Five”.
With Quentin Kirrin and his wife in quarantine for scarlet fever, the children are sent to stay with Professor Hayling and his son, Tinker. An exciting adventure begins when a circus comes to town and some ‘top secret’ notes disappear from the Professor’s study.

results.title: Flash William
results.creator_credit: John Laing, Thom Burstyn, Arthur Hammond, Michael McKennirey and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Flash William Shewchuck is a one-man movie industry. He combines the roles of film producer, director, camera man, actor, promoter, projectionist and ticket taker. In between productions, he works elsewhere to finance his company. In this film about his latest feature, “Dawson City Joe”, he reveals his style and technique. Some of his innovations, developed by Flash in the isolation of the wilderness, have long been used in the industry. Voice and narration by Stanley Jackson.
